R. H. D. November 18, 1907.
My dear Neihardt:—
div1.p: The Face in the Balcony, which appeared in the October number of THE ALL-STORY, 1905, goes forward under separate cover.
Bully for The Bundle! I shall value highly any copy you choose to send me. Of course, if it is red, so much the better.
If Waters reaches the dignity of a drama, it is more than a small triumph for both of us. It is a large one.

Now that we receive so few of your manuscripts, it seems as though you had practially disappeared from the face of the earth, — a condition which I trust will never eventuate. The least you can do is to write me occasionally and believe always that I am glad to hear from you.

Confidentially, between you and me only, I have tackled the drama myself lately and am expecting next Wednesday to receive some definite information from a Broadway producer as to whether I land or whether I don't. I shall let you know the result. In the meantime, my respects to your Mother, and believe me,
